> Anyways, that's not really necessary for level generation. We just 
need to generate the terrain and the dudes.

I set up the forms neccesary to allow the user to have control over 
what type of characters (living family) to place in the scenario [so 
you could randomly populate with just soldiers or with golems and 
towers] and what types of treasures (treasure family) to place in the 
scenario.  I plan on running a test pretty soon to ensure the code for 
 the randoming choosing works in coordination with the forms.

On the other hand, I finally found the one section of source code I 
have been hunting: the code [ void viewscreen::view_team(short left, 
short top, short right, short bottom) ] that controls the display of 
team stats while you are playing a scenario.  I plan on doing 
calculations to readjust the spacing of information in the table after 
I study that section of code for a while.  When I think I have it 
right to make the spacing work, I'll email to you guys. [I am going to 
summon a fire elemental since his stats take up the most space and use 
that to determine how to readjust the spacing to prevent overlap.]
